qas.question: Which health issue is now becoming a common issue in developing countries?
Which organization did a study on cancer in developing countries?

answers.text: International Agency for Research on Cancer

qas.question: What were cancers such as liver cancer or stomach cancer found to have a link to?
The rise of lung cancer in poor nations can be attributed to the use of which product?
Obesity, lack of exercise, age and diet are risk factors attributed to cancer that are all apart of what kind of lifestyle?

context: <a0_0>Cancer<a0_0/> is now common in developing countries. According to a study by the <a1_0>International Agency for Research on Cancer<a1_0/>, "In the developing world, cancers of the liver, stomach and esophagus were more common, often linked to <a2_0>consumption of carcinogenic preserved foods<a2_0/>, such as smoked or salted food, and parasitic infections that attack organs." Lung cancer rates are rising rapidly in poorer nations because of increased use of <a3_0>tobacco<a3_0/>. Developed countries "tended to have cancers linked to affluence or a '<a4_0>Western<a4_0/> lifestyle' — cancers of the colon, rectum, breast and prostate — that can be caused by obesity, lack of exercise, diet and age."
